comment: SARS-CoV-2 is a Coronavirus, it has a viral envelope formed of proteins that can be destroyed by exposure to 80%+ C2H5OH Ethanol hand sanitizer. It is true that SOME viruses that are non enveloped (norovirus famously) cannot be killed this way, but SARS-COV-2 can. https://t.co/uf7aHxdVRq
@drphiliplee1 Isnt a lot of supermarket stuff too weak, in terms of ethanol content, but nice-smelling?
Fighting the spread of #Covid_19 is hard enough but also having to fight misinformation is harder.Please follow only reputable sources for advice:@WHO @DHSCgovuk @PHE_uk @CDCgov
@luvdolapo Agree that antibiotics won't work for viruses. But alcohol based hand sanitizer will help prevent Coronavirus, as it will kill bacteria, fungi, and viruses alike.
@drphiliplee1 So washing my hands in navy strength gin won't cut the envelope!!!!

The advice from the @WHO is clear, use hand gel if your hands are not visibly soiled and wash them if they are with normal mild soap and tepid water.Washing will clear off dirt likely to harbour pathogens which hand gel won't necessarily penetrate. https://t.co/MOlAvhUJ5t
@Tuttlebees Only good for drinking I'm afraid
@mickylategate In general, to be on the market in the UK they have to be above 60% alcohol and should be effective against Coronavirus

Of note, the OP when this was pointed out, immediately doubled down (unsurprisingly for this hellsite) but also made extensive use of the hide replies function, making it seem like everyone was agreeing with her.The post got thousands of likes and RT before being deleted.

In most circumstances, alcohol based hand sanitizer will do the job just fine, especially if you are in situation without water or soap (eg public transport)Please see this paper attached regarding the efficacy of alcohol based hand sanitizer. https://t.co/eu4LbxJJVt
@drphiliplee1 Aargh! The "expert" on Radio4 the other day said soap and water was the best way to kill the virus. Who to believe?
@drphiliplee1 @threadreaderapp unroll please
@drphiliplee1 I'd kiss you for this info... But... You know... Safety first ?
@drphiliplee1 Cosplayer *and* scientist or cosplayer *playing* a scientist? https://t.co/uSrp1VEBwo
@drphiliplee1 Dunno, Ive been drinking the damn stuff all day and I cant stop coughing.
@ElbaDragon @drphiliplee1 Patience of the dog!
@drphiliplee1 It must have 70% alcohol content
@Tattooed_Mummy @drphiliplee1 Elbow bump?

@jmkarski @drphiliplee1 60% is fine! In the lab we use 70% ethanol rather than higher (in spray form) because higher percentages can evaporate more rapidly and so reduce contact time with the pathogens.
@drphiliplee1 @The_Holy_Log Okay if you can actually find any.
@lulumccoy @drphiliplee1 @The_Holy_Log You can make your own with pure aloe Vera gel , rubbing alcohol ( or even Vodka) and add a couple of drops of tea tree oil if you have it
@ChrisDanvers07 @drphiliplee1 Either will work fine. 70% generally works best because it's the best compromise between ability to kill stuff and time before evaporation.
@iamtheavalanche @drphiliplee1 @RJMrgn To be fair, she had amazing legs.

@drphiliplee1 What about 60 to 70% alcohol? Is ethanol the only alcohol that works or does isopropyl alcohol work as well?Would that still be effective against this virus or might as well not even try?
@drphiliplee1 @lemonjellii Oops- you pretty much said this in the thread anyway?

@drphiliplee1 @lemonjellii Hand sanitiser will work to an extent, but it should be an alcohol based one, not an anti bacterial gel one where the virus remains in gel. Effective hand washing, with hot water and soap, is better than hand sanitiser, washing off the virus, but hand sanitiser is better than 0.

@hugefoodlover In those cases, soap and water is fine. But as far as I know alcohol hand gel isn't forbidden by the Qur'an, as long as you don't drink it.Alcohol hand gels kill bacteria AND viruses, like bleach.
@drphiliplee1 @RJMrgn Were they cosplaying as a scientist?
@drphiliplee1 I wouldn't be surprised if the same person hasn't bought up all of the local stocks of sanitizer to sell on at five times the price on ebay.
@drphiliplee1 Nothing like confirmation bias.... People hear what they want to hear... thank you for your service Dr.

@drphiliplee1 Hand sanitizers are a moot point where I am- they are all sold out in every shop in Romford. A delivery arrived in one particular major store that morning only to be sold out by lunchtime. The panic buying is beginning #Covid_19

@drphiliplee1 There is shortage of ethanol which is main ingredient in sanitizer.

@chrisccoulson @drphiliplee1 And I read single malt whisky should do it.My plan, I am over 80, vitamin D 4000 is, vitamin C  two grams, the Singleton, old Bowmore single malts, getting out in the fresh air. Wash your hands.
